task.title: How to update a file?
task.shortdesc: You can update a file on GitHub after making changes to the file on your local project folder on your computer.

taskbody.context:
You will make the changes and save the file in your local project folder.
Perform these steps in Git Bash or Windows Cmd window to update a file in your GitHub repository.

step.cmd: Use git status command to check the status of your repository. See which files are inside it, which changes still need to be committed, and which branch of the repository you’re currently working on.
Use git add command to bring new files to Git’s attention. After you add files, they’re included in Git’s “snapshots” of the repository.
Use git commit after you make any sort of change, to take a “snapshot” of the repository.
step.info: Usually it goes git commit -m “Message here.” The -m indicates that the following section of the command should be read as a message.

step.cmd: Use git push command to push the changes you made on your local computer to GitHub.

taskbody.result: Your file is updated in your GitHub repository.
